entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Late Latin satisfaction-, satisfactio, from Latin, reparation, amends, from satisfacere to satisfy

def.dt: :the payment through penance of the temporal punishment incurred by a sin
:reparation for sin that meets the demands of divine justice
:the quality or state of being satisfied :contentment
:compensation for a loss or injury :atonement restitution
:the discharge of a legal obligation or claim
:convinced assurance or certainty proved to the satisfaction of the court
:a usually smug satisfaction with oneself or one's position or achievements
